content: rounds 1-10 k2 p2 repeat around side of the heel flap pick up 1 extra stitch in the ladder in the row below leg k across the instep stitches round 1 -- 29 knit around pick up 1 extra stitch in the ladder in the row below round 30 k across the first half of your stitches pick up 10 12 14 stitches along the side of the heel flap 20 24 28 and then start the heel flap and then knit across to the marker this will have you set up to work the heel flap on the back of the sock you will now begin decreasing by repeating the following two rounds until you are back down to your original stitch **if you wish to do a shorter or longer leg that is perfectly fine count of 40 48 56 just do the length you prefer ** round 1 k to 3 sts before the instep begins k2tog k1 slip_stitch heel flap knit across instep in pattern k1 ssk knit to end of round your heel flap will be worked flat across half of your total stitches 20 24 28 round 2 k all sts *make sure that you are working this on the once you are back to your original stitch count continue back of your sock * knitting the foot until the foot length measures 1 5 1 75 2 inches shorter than your desired length row 1 rs *sl 1 purlwise with yarn in back k1* then continue to instructions for the toe repeat across row row 2 ws sl 1 purlwise with yarn in front toe purl across row following are instructions for a basic rounded toe repeat these two row a total of 10 12 14 times this is my favorite way to do toes on my socks you will end with a total of 20 24 28 row on your heel flap you can of course feel free to substitute and use your favorite toe heel turn round 1 k to 3 sts before instep k2tog k1 row 1 rs sl 1 purlwise with yarn in back k 10 12 14 k1 ssk k to last 3 sts of instep k2tog k1 ssk k1 turn k1 ssk k to end of round row 2 ws sl 1 purlwise with yarn in front p3 round 2 k all sts p2tog p1 turn repeat round 1 and 2 until 20 24 28 stitches remain row 3 sl 1 purlwise with yarn in back k to 1 st before gap ssk k1 turn repeat round 1 until 12 stitches remain since the beginning of the round is in the middle of the foot row 4 sl 1 purlwise with yarn in front you will need to knit the next 3 sts so that you end up on the p to 1 st before gap p2tog p1 turn side of the toe *do not sl first stitch on very last purl row you will purl it
